command_description: short for list, shows all the files/folder where you currently are.
subject: file management

command_description: go to a different directory or file
subject: file management
required_parameters_or_arguments: what file or directory you want to navigate to

command_description: tell you where you are in the filesystem
subject: file management

command_description: prints out the contents of the file
subject: file management

command_description: used to move or rename a file.
subject: file management
required_parameters_or_arguments: argument 1: what to rename it, argument 2: where to move it || argument 1: what to rename it, argument 2: what your renaming it

command_description: initialize a local repository in the folder you are cur.rently working in.
subject: file management, git

command_description: add some files to be tracked (always!).
subject: file management, git
required_parameters_or_arguments: file name || if you want to add all files in current directory/ file just do a period like this: git add .

command_description: creates a snapshot of the files you just added or are tracking.
subject: file management, git
required_parameters_or_arguments: 1st argument is what branch you are commiting the files to (usually will just be -m), 2nd argument is the name of the commit always in quotations

command_description: tells you about this repository you are currently working in
subject: file management, git

command_description: show you a list of the commits, in reverse order in the repository you are currently working in.
subject: file management, git

command_description: tells you what you have changed since last commit on the repository you are currently working in
subject: file management, git

command_description: uses node to run the file's code and show the given output of that code ran.
subject: node
required_parameters_or_arguments: required argument is: whatever file you want to run the code on so code would look like this: node
